objects.description:
This person will manage financial organization, budgeting, control, forecasting, systems and process implementations. A successful Controller candidate will manage accounting, reporting, finance, budgeting and modeling functions, including billings, A/R, A/P and Payroll. Reports directly to the Vice President of Operations.

 Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Ensure that company financial records and reports are maintained in compliance with company policies and US GAAP (accrual basis). Responsible for preparing monthly/quarterly draft financial statements, forecasts, account reconciliations and other documents to ensure this compliance.
  • Calculate and issue financial and operating metrics.
  • Implement policies and procedures (internal controls) to provide reasonable assurance that the company assets are protected.
  • Ensure only valid expenses with proper management authorization are paid and that accounts payable are paid in a timely manner
  • Own the chart of accounts and maintain an orderly accounting filing system
  • Ensure that (i) contract terms evolve and are administered effectively in accordance with company policy (ii) credit risk and other negotiable terms are balanced with business objectives and (iii) progress toward targets are clearly communicated.
  • Responsible for proper timing and application of revenue recognition rules. Involves significant interaction with Sales and Customer Service groups.
  • Ensure the completion of Federal and State tax reporting requirements (including income, property, sales and use, payroll and other local taxes), insurance reports and other reports that may be required by government entities.
  • Coordinate work relating to external audits in the periodic review of the company financial records.
  • Responsible for the implementation of agreed upon recommendations, related to areas of responsibility, resulting from the audit findings.
  • Startup mentality! This is a fast-growing startup environment and the candidate must have a willingness to pitch-in when asked to support other areas.

Degree/Licenses Required:

  • 4-year undergraduate degree (preferably in Accounting)
  • CPA certification

Prior Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years of accounting experience, with top-tier public accounting being a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to plan and close books and prepare financial statements monthly
  • Experience analyzing business performance and developing financial plans within a startup environment desirable.
  • Understanding of US GAAP, internal controls and financial reporting required.

About Spring & Our Engineering Team

Spring was founded with one simple vision: to create the best mobile shopping experience. Members of our team have helped change the world through their previous work building products used and loved by hundreds of millions of people at tech companies like Google, Foursquare and Medium. Now we’re working together to re-imagine mobile commerce.

Our engineering team, more specifically, is creating a high performance infrastructure, and we chose a high performing language, Go, upon which to build it. We’re mostly generalists who work on all components of our stack, often switching from one product to another. We’re collaborative; it’s important to us that our dev environment be one where you can get very good at what you do very quickly, and where you have both responsibility and support.

Things like good coding style, a continuous build, tests are part of the process early on. We're very passionate about great engineering and about striking the right balance between speed, maintainability and scalability.

Our current stack is Go, PostgreSQL, AngularJS and iOS and we picked them thoughtfully because they are the right tools that will help us move fast and build high quality products.

 

What Will our Interns Do?

We're looking for interns who love to get stuff done, but also understand code quality, large scale, and the tradeoffs that come with each choice they make. As a Spring Summer engineering intern, you will be given a real project to work on that will ship as part of our consumer iOS and/or brand facing app. You will get individual mentorship from members of our engineering team, seasoned programmers with a lot of experience at tech companies both small and large.

At other companies, your internship will be strongly patterned after the interns that came 1 or even 10 years before you. At Spring, you’ll be a member of our very first intern class, so you’ll not only get to ship code, you’ll be creating your experience organically from day one. You’ll be given a vision for the future of our app, and the responsibility to own your part in it’s creation.

We’re a small company, and we’re very transparent, so you’ll see everything that goes into building Spring: code, marketing, sales, design, customer support, brand curation, etc., the kind of stuff you would never learn somewhere bigger or more corporate. You’ll also get one on one time with our leadership, who make a point of making sure each employee’s work is seen.

And if that's not enough, we’re located in New York, so when you need a break from coding, you can rent a CitiBike and explore, take in a world class show or concert, or go have a bowl of ramen (or whatever your culinary pleasure is) at one of the amazing restaurants all over the city.

 

Requirements

  • The internship will last between 10 - 12 weeks, so you must be available for that amount of time this summer with flexibility

  • Must live or relocate to NY for the duration of the internship

  • Preference will be given to students between their Junior and Senior years at a 4 year academic institution or enrolled in a Masters or PHD program. If you're a brainiac right out of highschool, that's great too! Just be able to show us your work and tell us why you're a good fit.

  • Comfort with switching languages and learning new ones. Go is a young language and we don't expect you to be proficient in it, but you will have to pick it up.

  • A Computer Science major

  • Great communication skills



Benefits

  • Competitive salary ($4,000/month)

  • $1,500 monthly housing stipend

  • Free soft drinks, coffee and snacks everyday

  • Free lunches twice a week in office and free breakfast in office every Monday, Wednesday and Friday

  • One on one mentorship with one of our awesome engineers

  • Monthly team events around New York



About Spring

Our office is a unique hybrid of engineers and our brand team. Though our backgrounds in development and fashion may seem an odd pairing, we’re actually a tight knit bunch! You’ll find us cranking, guzzling cold brew and/or having late night dinners in our awesome office in the heart of SoHo.

We provide our employees with a happy, productive workplace, and we’re constantly improving! We keep a stocked fridge, bring in breakfast 3 times a week, lunch on Tuesdays and Thursdays. We love karaoke, our kickball team, and our office pup, Gizmo.
